WhiteHouse.title: Thanksgiving Day, 2025
WhiteHouse.summary: President Donald J. Trump issued a proclamation declaring Thursday, November 27, 2025, as a National Day of Thanksgiving. The proclamation references the historical origins of Thanksgiving, citing proclamations by Presidents George Washington and Abraham Lincoln. It highlights gratitude for the nation's progress, such as economic improvement, reducing the cost of living, global peace efforts, and national sovereignty restoration. The proclamation encourages Americans to gather in homes and places of worship to offer prayers of thanks. This Thanksgiving also marks the 250th anniversary of American independence.

WhiteHouse.title: 72 Arrests Wasn’t Enough — Democrats Let Him Burn Her Alive
WhiteHouse.summary: The press release states that in Chicago, a 26-year-old woman was attacked and set on fire by a man with a criminal record, including multiple felony convictions and misdemeanors. The attacker was reportedly released under a "no cash bail" law supported by Governor JB Pritzker and Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson. The release criticizes these policies for allowing the attacker to remain free despite previous violations of electronic monitoring. It also claims that former President Trump is working to improve safety in cities by opposing these policies, supporting police, and increasing federal resources.
